page.title: 11Poultry Farming
page.content: The cages are 16 inches square, each , one holding 4 chickens. The cages are stacked in flats 4 storeys high. The chickens have a pecking order,taking it in turns to eat the seed. Opinions vary about this type of factory farming, but Mr Peck said the chickens would not lay eggs if they were not happy!. The huts are made from stone and brick which were ammunition shelters during World War Two. The sheds are cleaned out once a week. There is some smell and a few flies, but there are very few complaints from neighbours. The eggs are taken to the sorting department and you can see them on well known supermarket shelves.
